definitions.definition: (transitive) To cease giving breast milk to an offspring; to accustom and reconcile (a child or young animal) to a want or deprivation of mother's milk; to take from the breast or udder.
definitions.example: The cow has weaned her calf.

definitions.definition: (intransitive) To cease to depend on the mother's milk for nutrition.
(transitive, by extension, normally "wean off") To cause to quit something to which one is addicted, dependent, or habituated.
definitions.example: He managed to wean himself off heroin.

definitions.definition: (intransitive, by extension) To cease to depend.
definitions.example: She is weaning from her addiction to tobacco.

definitions.definition: (transitive, by extension, obsolete) To raise, to help grow toward maturity
